metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11636 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a heap overflow in the WriteRGBImage() functionin coders/rgb.c when processing multiple frames that have non-identicalwidths.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-4
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-4
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-4
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-4
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-4').
